status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This is not a Spring problem - it's rather simply Hibernate not finding one of its dependencies. The JTA API is part of the J2EE server classpath but needs to be added manually in other environments. You can find jta.jar in the lib directory of the Hibernate as well as of the Spring distribution.

Juergen
